chapters.heading: Homeschool robotics made easy: Start robotics at home with RoboCamp and LEGO
chapters.text:
Getting started with robotics and programming at home might feel overwhelming, especially if you don't have a tech background. But once you find your footing, it becomes a worthwhile activity you and your kids can genuinely enjoy together.

**Working on STEM projects as part of your homeschooling curriculum builds valuable skills**: breaking down problems, coming up with creative solutions, and learning to tinker and adapt. It‚Äôs not just about robots and code‚Äîit‚Äôs about building things, exploring ideas, and seeing how your kid lights up when their creation moves for the first time.

Whether you're just beginning or figuring out what tools to pick, **RoboCamp lesson plans and LEGO Education offer a path that meets you right where you are, so you and your kids can genuinely enjoy exploring programming and robotics together**.

(Teach robotics and programming at home)

chapters.heading: Who is Qualified to Teach Robotics at Home
chapters.text:
### Who is Qualified to Teach Robotics at Home

**You are.** If robotics has caught your interest, that‚Äôs really all it takes to begin.

You don‚Äôt need a tech background to get started‚Äîjust curiosity. **Educational robotics is built for beginners, so you‚Äôll pick up what you need as you go.** At a basic level, it‚Äôs about motors that make things move, sensors that respond to the world around them, and code that ties it all together.

Beginner robots are designed to be approachable. Some come with short guides or video tutorials, but step-by-step lesson plans with clear explanations are what truly make a difference (that‚Äôs exactly why we created RoboCamp the way we did).

You can check in with homeschool groups online or lean on a structured curriculum. It‚Äôs all manageable‚Äîeven if you are learning together with your students.

Don‚Äôt hold back. **With a good resource and a bit of time, you‚Äôll grow more confident with every new build.**

chapters.heading: Why LEGO Sets are Perfect for Homeschooling
chapters.text:
### Why LEGO Sets are Perfect for Homeschooling

* LEGO sets fit homeschooling well‚Äîkids learn by building and exploring
* Kits are ready-to-use and grow with your kid by adjusting project difficulty
* RoboCamp‚Äôs step-by-step lessons give parents the confidence to teach robotics‚Äîeven if they‚Äôve never coded before

If the idea of teaching robotics and programming at home makes you pause, you're not alone. But with the right resources, what seems tricky at first often turns out to be a rewarding experience for both you and your kid.

**Because kids naturally learn by doing, LEGO sets are an ideal fit.** Through building and experimenting, they start understanding how machines work and how to control them with code. And since most kids already love playing with LEGO, there's no need to convince them to dive in‚Äîthey're already halfway there. STEM becomes something they want to explore, not just another subject to check off the list.

The kits are ready to use right out of the box, with intuitive software designed for both kids and parents. A single LEGO Education set can serve multiple age groups (6‚Äì9 years and 9‚Äì12 years), simply by adjusting project complexity and programming language.

And if you already have a box of LEGO bricks at home (which many families do), you can enhance RoboCamp projects even further, extending creativity and expanding learning time without additional investment.

>"Before RoboCamp, we were guessing our way through coding lessons," said Marta, a homeschooling parent of two. "Now my kids look forward to 'robot day'‚Äîand I do, too."

With the kind of support RoboCamp offers‚Äîclear lessons, easy-to-follow instructions, and plenty of visuals‚Äîit‚Äôs much easier to feel prepared, even if this is your first time teaching anything tech-related. Whether you're just starting out or have a few years of experience under your belt, having that extra structure makes a big difference.

#### LEGO Education WeDo 2.0 ‚Äì best for younger kids (ages 6‚Äì9)

(Examples of robots made with WeDo 2.0)

WeDo 2.0 is a beginner-friendly robotics kit ideal for early learners.

Although it‚Äôs now officially considered a "retired product," it remains one of LEGO Education‚Äôs best-value sets. You can still find used kits for around $150‚Äì200 online, which matches the original price when first bought as new.

Curious about what else the LEGO WeDo 2.0 kit can do? Dive into our blog for in-depth articles and [a full WeDo 2.0 review](https://www.robocamp.eu/en/blog/lego-education-wedo2-review/), packed with examples, ideas, and hands-on tips.

**Parts included:**

* 280+ LEGO elements
* Smart hub with Bluetooth
* Motor, tilt sensor, and distance sensor
* Durable storage box with labeled sorting trays
* Powered by either rechargeable battery or 2x AA batteries (not included)

**Programming options:**

* Icon blocks in WeDo 2.0 software (based on Scratch)
* Fully compatible with Scratch 3.0
* Available on Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, and Chromebook

**Key advantages of WeDo 2.0:**

* Simple, visual coding perfect for beginners
* Great hands-on introduction to robotics and mechanics
* Fully compatible with RoboCamp curriculum
* Perfect for individual learners or co-op groups

**Examples of robots you can build:**

* Motorcycle that detects objects
* Ferris wheel using belt drives and gears
* Owl robot using tilt sensors and conditional programming

SPIKE Prime is the most advanced and flexible set currently offered by LEGO Education, making it a top choice for any homeschool STEM education program.

It‚Äôs a long-term investment, supporting 2‚Äì4 years of progressive STEM learning‚Äîfrom block-based coding to professional-level Python programming.

chapters.heading: Why We Recommend Only These Two Sets for Homeschooling?
chapters.text:
#### Why We Recommend Only These Two Sets for Homeschooling?

After years of hands-on work with LEGO Education, we‚Äôve come to trust two sets above all for homeschool STEM learning: SPIKE Prime and WeDo 2.0. We‚Äôve created more than 100 complete lesson plans for them, adding up to more than 200 hours of structured activities. Compare that with how quickly a regular LEGO set is used up‚Äîand it‚Äôs clear how much more learning and engagement these kits deliver.

**They‚Äôre not just fun; they keep kids building, thinking, and learning for months**.

We also appreciate how adaptable these sets are. **WeDo 2.0 works seamlessly with Scratch, while SPIKE Prime connects with creative tools like Tinkercad**‚Äîideal for designing and printing 3D models or even prepping laser-cut parts. That kind of flexibility is hard to find elsewhere.

We know homeschool budgets are carefully planned. That‚Äôs exactly why we recommend these two sets‚Äîthey‚Äôve consistently offered the best value in helping kids develop real, lasting STEM skills at home.

**Are you already using a different LEGO Education set, like SPIKE Essential or LEGO MINDSTORMS?** That‚Äôs alright too, use what you have! We‚Äôve worked with these kits for years and know how to get the most out of them. Check our lesson plans created [for SPIKE Essential](https://www.robocamp.eu/en/lessons/tag/spike-essential/#lessons) and [for MINDSTORMS](https://www.robocamp.eu/en/lessons/tag/mindstorms/) kits.

RoboCamp courses are designed to help you make the absolute best use of what you already own, so you can keep moving forward without needing to buy anything new right away.
